item.title: Physically Based Shading
item.description: Physically based shading (PBS) is a rendering technique used in computer graphics to create realistic materials and lighting in 3D scenes. Unlike traditional rendering techniques, which rely on ad hoc methods to simulate lighting and material properties, physically based shading is based on the laws of physics and provides a more accurate and consistent way to render objects. Principles of Physically Based Shading At the heart of physically based shading is the idea that light interacts with surfaces in a physically accurate way.

item.title: Casting Shadows
item.description: Casting shadows is an important aspect of 3D computer graphics that helps to create a sense of depth and realism in a scene.
